meanings.sent1: The sporogenic fungi released tiny spores into the air.
meanings.sent2: The sporogenic plants scattered spores for reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The sporogenic mushrooms seemed to be playing a spore-filled game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The sporogenic forest was like a spore factory, constantly churning out new life.
meanings.sent5: The sporogenic process in nature is like a magical spore dance of creation.

meanings.definition: Relating to the formation of spores
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the sporogenic structures of different plants.
meanings.sent2: The sporogenic cycle of the ferns was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent3: The sporogenic patterns on the leaves looked like spore constellations.
meanings.sent4: The sporogenic changes in the environment signaled the start of a new spore season.
meanings.sent5: The sporogenic characteristics of the moss were crucial for its spore production.
